speaker: Tunnel
lines: Stone sweats in a way that makes torches whisper.
The roar of the crowd becomes a heartbeat you can aim at.
Footprints overlapâ€”some came back, some are still out there.
A chalk mark: two lines and a circle; someone else's ritual.
You touch it and promise nothing.
Sand drifts inward, testing how the day will end.
The bell pulls the rope and you with it.
Time becomes shorter and taller at once.

choices.text: Slip back to the locker room.
Detour to the promoter for last words.
